                        <item>
                    <title>Shampoo is causing air pollution, but let’s not lose our heads</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161393-shampoo-is-causing-air-pollution-but-lets-not-lose-our-heads/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>In Western cities, household products like deodorants and paints are a bigger source of air pollution than vehicle exhausts – so here’s what we need to do</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161393</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>CRISPR has fixed the genetic cause of a learning disability</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161345-crispr-has-fixed-the-genetic-cause-of-a-learning-disability/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>CRISPR gene editing has been used to alleviate the genetic disorder fragile X syndrome, but the technique has only been tried in cells in a dish so far</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161345</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Stem cells zapped with radiation can protect mice from cancer</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161378-stem-cells-zapped-with-radiation-can-protect-mice-from-cancer/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Injections of killed stem cells, designed to help the immune system recognise cancers, have been found to protect mice from developing tumours</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161378</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Surgical instruments may spread Alzheimer’s proteins</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161290-surgical-instruments-may-spread-alzheimers-proteins/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Amyloid protein, which is linked to Alzheimer’s disease, may be spread via surgical implements, but there isn’t evidence yet that this can transmit the disease</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161290</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Transgender woman is first to be able to breastfeed her baby</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161151-transgender-woman-is-first-to-be-able-to-breastfeed-her-baby/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 11:20:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>An experimental treatment regimen has enabled a transgender woman to exclusively breastfeed her baby for six weeks, during which time the baby grew healthily</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161151</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Valentine’s Day seems to cause a mini baby-boom 9 months later</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161141-valentines-day-seems-to-cause-a-mini-baby-boom-9-months-later/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 10:41:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>National Health Service data reveals that around Valentine’s Day there is a 5 per cent rise in the number of babies conceived in England</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161141</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Opioid painkillers are prescribed more in northern England</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2161121-opioid-painkillers-are-prescribed-more-in-northern-england/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Tue, 13 Feb 2018 18:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>The opioid crisis may have crossed the Atlantic, with signs that opioid painkillers are prescribed more in England in socially-deprived areas in the north</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2161121</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>First glimpse of how genes may cause mental health problems</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160697-first-glimpse-of-how-genes-may-cause-mental-health-problems/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Tue, 13 Feb 2018 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Geneticists are starting to unpick what causes psychiatric conditions like schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, and even some autism-like developmental conditions</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160697</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>We need to start taking vaping seriously as a way to save lives</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160742-we-need-to-start-taking-vaping-seriously-as-a-way-to-save-lives/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 17:40:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>E-cigarettes were once seen as a sinister cousin to ordinary smoking. Now doctors in the UK think they could be a public health lifeline</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160742</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Deadly superbugs are evolving to beat alcohol hand sanitisers</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160745-deadly-superbugs-are-evolving-to-beat-alcohol-hand-sanitisers/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 14:30:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Alcohol-based hand sanitisers were introduced in hospitals to stop the spread of drug-resistant superbugs like MRSA. Now it seems the bacteria have got the upper hand</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160745</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>The doctor who exposed the UK’s terrible experiments on patients</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731640-800-the-doctor-who-exposed-the-uks-terrible-experiments-on-patients/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>In the 1960s, British medics took sometimes fatal liberties with unsuspecting patients in the name of science. Maurice Pappworth wasn't having any of it</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">http://mg23731640.800</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Primitive human eggs matured in the lab for the first time</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160676-primitive-human-eggs-matured-in-the-lab-for-the-first-time/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Fri, 09 Feb 2018 18:01:00 +0000</pubDate>
                    		<category><![CDATA[biology]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[genetics]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[health]]></category>
		<category><![CDATA[medicine]]></category>
                    <description>Human eggs have been removed in their most primitive state and brought to maturity in the lab for the first time, potentially boosting fertility treatments.</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160676</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>The truth about what downing energy drinks really does to kids</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731644-500-the-truth-about-what-downing-energy-drinks-really-does-to-kids/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Fri, 09 Feb 2018 11:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Campaigners in the UK want energy drinks banned for under-16s. The latest scientific evidence suggests they are right – these drinks are uniquely bad for children</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">http://mg23731644.500</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Fears of Brexit chaos for medicines agency should worry us all</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160626-fears-of-brexit-chaos-for-medicines-agency-should-worry-us-all/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 08 Feb 2018 11:09:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Fresh turmoil threatens to worsen disruption of the European Medicines Agency when it quits the UK after Brexit. That should worry all parties, says Inga Vesper</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160626</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>We can now read the whole genome of a fetus in the womb</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731643-100-we-can-now-read-the-whole-genome-of-a-fetus-in-the-womb/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Thu, 08 Feb 2018 10:30:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Knowing the ins and outs of our children's genetic secrets before they are born could help reduce the likelihood of many diseases – but could it be misused?</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">http://mg23731643.100</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Training parents to work in hospitals benefits premature babies</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160599-training-parents-to-work-in-hospitals-benefits-premature-babies/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Wed, 07 Feb 2018 23:30:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>When the parents of premature babies in intensive care units are trained in basic nursing care and put to work, their infants put on weight more quickly</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160599</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>A much better asthma drug has shown promise in early experiments</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160609-a-much-better-asthma-drug-has-shown-promise-in-early-experiments/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Wed, 07 Feb 2018 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
                                        <description>Existing asthma drugs can fade in effectiveness and have side effects. But preliminary experiments suggest a new kind of drug could be more effective</description>
                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160609</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>I got DNA tested to see if I would pass on diseases to my kids</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160523-i-got-dna-tested-to-see-if-i-would-pass-on-diseases-to-my-kids/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Wed, 07 Feb 2018 13:28:00 +0000</pubDate>

                    <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.newscientist.com/?post_type=article&p=2160523</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>The love drug that could draw people away from any addiction</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731630-500-the-love-drug-that-could-draw-people-away-from-any-addiction/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Tue, 06 Feb 2018 17:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

                    <guid isPermaLink="false">http://mg23731630.500</guid>
                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Some people with epilepsy can learn to stop their own seizures</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160323-some-people-with-epilepsy-can-learn-to-stop-their-own-seizures/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Mon, 05 Feb 2018 16:56:00 +0000</pubDate>

                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>The unpalatable truth about your favourite foods</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731630-400-the-unpalatable-truth-about-your-favourite-foods/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Mon, 05 Feb 2018 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

                                <item>
                    <title>Defence strategies: How immunology took its great leap forward</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731630-800-defence-strategies-how-immunology-took-its-great-leap-forward/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>

                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>First UK three-parent babies could be born this year</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160120-first-uk-three-parent-babies-could-be-born-this-year/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>
                    <pubDate>Fri, 02 Feb 2018 11:35:00 +0000</pubDate>

                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Brain genes hint at why Zika doesn’t always cause microcephaly</title>

                    <pubDate>Fri, 02 Feb 2018 10:00:00 +0000</pubDate>

                                <item>
                    <title>Pregnant women have to navigate a minefield of painkiller advice</title>

                                <item>
                    <title>At least three types of bacteria may help cause bowel cancer</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/2160068-at-least-three-types-of-bacteria-may-help-cause-bowel-cancer/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>

                                <item>
                    <title>Pocket-sized scanner helps fill gaps in the human genome</title>

                                <item>
                    <title>Depriving the brain of a sense may improve stroke recovery</title>

                                <item>
                    <title>Trump’s 90-day plan for opioids has failed – here’s a better one</title>
                    <link>https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23731632-500-trumps-90-day-plan-for-opioids-has-failed-heres-a-better-one/?utm_campaign=RSS%7CNSNS&utm_source=NSNS&utm_medium=RSS&utm_content=health&campaign_id=RSS%7CNSNS-health</link>

                                                        </item>
                                <item>
                    <title>Time for the UK to stop dithering and add folic acid to bread</title>

                                <item>
                    <title>Can a brain implant treat Alzheimer’s? It might just be placebo</title>

                                <item>

                                <item>
